Vi Vadi Hotel Downtown Munich
8 Very good
Based on 524 reviews

I traveled with 2 co-workers to Munich after a trade show in Europe, booked 3 rooms for 2 nights. My boss checked in couple hours before 2 of us.

We arrived at the hotel on June 27 at around 10pm. The front desk lady was rude. First she asked me why I have 6 room reservations. I couldn't answer her question because on my confirmation letter only showed 3 rooms were booked but I explained to her my boss have checked in. It took her 10 mins to figure out the situation. Then, we asked for 2 smoking rooms. She rolled her eyes and started mumbling. OK finally we got our keys. She told us our rooms are on 6th floor. We went up there, couldn't find the rooms. On the keys we saw roman number IV. our rooms are on 4th floor, but she told us 6th. Other than that lady at the front desk, other staff are really nice and helpful! rooms are clean and have good size. Good location, only few minutes walk from the central station.

Show more
Man , Hong Kong
Novum Hotel München – Am Hauptbahnhof
7.5 Very good
Based on 984 reviews

The most important asset of this hotel is its close proximity to the central train station. Depending and your mode of transportation, arriving and departing is easy and convenient from this location.

The property itself is a budget hotel that satisfies all the basic expectations. The hotel has a nice minimalist lobby. Our standard room had good size, and we were comfortable. We appreciated the flat-screen TV with international channels and the safety-deposit box. The carpeting on our floor seemed a bit worn, and we would recommend changing it. More importantly, we had requested early check-in because we arrived after an intercontinental trip. We killed some time and arrived at the hotel at 11:00 AM. The gentleman at the reception courteously informed us that our room was not yet ready and that he could not be sure of the time when we could access it - but we had the impression that he did not even check to be sure about the availability of our room. We stored our luggage and went out in weather that was below freezing. Upon returning at 12:30 PM, our room was in fact prepared. All staff members with whom we interacted were polite and professional, and we would have been even happier with our stay if the original request for early check-in had been granted from the moment of our arrival.

Show more
Gunther , Mexico
Vi Vadi Hotel Bayer 89
8.5 Excellent
Based on 110 reviews

I love the hotel from its exterior to its interior design. It located near the central station, and a tram to travel to a lot of good shopping streets.

The room was clean and well designed. Just the wifi can only be used when the TV is on, but it doesn't really bother me much. The front dest staff was very very sweet, she lent me bandage when I asked for one. However, the biggest disappointment was the restaurant. I went downstairs for dinner around 8pm. The hotel has an Italian restaurant with Italian waiters. They sang randomly when I had my dinner, and it was very disturbing and rude. They served the plate in a very unprofessional and impolite way, and they gave me the bread without any olive oil or butter. The meal was horrible, does not worth for money at all. And at the end, they charged more for the cola. When I asked the waiter about the price difference from the receipt and the menu. He said he gave me the bigger cola (without asking me), so he should charged me more. When I insisted he should make me pay the same amount on the menu, he asked his manager. I finally paid the right price, but that waiter was rude and ignore me for the rest of the process. I was very tired on that day and need to go through all of these problems was a big let down.

Show more
Zhaowei , Australia
Hotel Exquisit
8.6 Excellent
Based on 105 reviews

The Maisonette room was very spacious. I emailed the hotel in advance to setup 2 extra beds for us for my kids.

They were very prompt with emails and when we got there the room were setup perfectly. Even though they quoted me a higher extra charge for the 2 extra people in our room, when we checked in they gave us 50% discount, which was a very nice gesture. The breakfast was awesome! The hotel location is perfect, it is 2 minutes walk to the U and S lines (sendlinger tor station) and 1 minute to almost all tram lines (sendlinger plaz). It is also walking distance (10 minutes) to MarienPlatz, which is the center of happening and there is route to there from the hotel that is closed to cars with many shopping and food on the way. The hotel sells day passes (buy partner pass if you’re more than 2 people) for zone-1 at the reception.

Show more
Cyrus , United States
Hotel Erzgiesserei Europe
8.3 Excellent
Based on 184 reviews

This was an overnight stay between a week in Vienna and an early flight to Houston which just happened to be the first day of October Fest.

Big parade. The receptionist was quite enthusiastic and friendly who helped us get our boarding passes printed for our flight the next morning. We had been traveling most of the day and wished to eat early so we visited with the wine-wise bartender for a while over a glass of wine and then enjoyed a very good venison dish. The presentation was awesome. If visiting the city to see sights, we would not have stayed here but its proximity to the rail transportation to the airport was the primary factor in the selection. We were blessed that the choice turned out as well as it did.

Show more
John , United States
NH Munich Deutscher Kaiser
8.2 Excellent
Based on 512 reviews

1.“Only” we had to wait in the lobby for a while (around 20 mins, maybe) after check-in, but other didn't.

2.Staying in our previous room about 20-30 mins, I responded that the heater in the room didn’t work, and the reception just asked us to wait for help. for 20-30 mins without any response from your stuff, so my wife called again about the heater problem (my daughter started feeling uneasy then). One hour later, someone brought us a very small heater. We tried to tell him that wasn’t sensible solution to us, but he couldn’t understand English at all. 3.I called the reception again, and she said that was the only solution. When she felt we were angry, she said that she could only give us more blankets, and no more. 4.I asked for changing to another room with heater, but she rejected as we were bad guests and asked too more (Is a warm room in winter time a special need in NH hotel?). After arguing for a while, she still firmly refused us and told us there was no available room. Till I asked her to be responsible for my daughter's condition, she just shut up and responded to find other solution. About 20-30 mins later without informed in advance “again”, a stuff asked us to move to another room with a normal heater. 5.However, it’s too late (2-year Asian kid in a non-heater room for more than 2 hrs). My daughter started getting uncomfortable and had a fever already in the later afternoon, almost 39-degree celcius in the midnight on 2/27. 6.Moreover, on the Saturday’s morning, before our check-out, the housekeeping opened our door without knocking twice (around 9 am and 10 am). Eventually, we changed our mind to leave NH because of your unexpectedly disturbing events again and again. 7.My wife was even too tired to be sick (fever that over 40-degree celcius and cough) and had the emergency on Monday’s midnight (3/2). Also my daughter is still sick now and we just went to see the doctor yesterday’s night. (3/3) 8. what a bad experience I had in NH.

Show more
Konica , Taiwan
Hotel Bayerischer Hof
8.7 Excellent
Based on 31 reviews

Eurostars Book Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 701 reviews

Very stylish and new looking. The room was nice- clean, tons of storage area, modern fixtures, comfortable bed, and so on.

The breakfast was something I looked forward to each morning- your typical but very good eggs, meat(s), fruit, bread(s), juices and coffee spread. The location is good, being right around the block from the Hbf. Yes, the area has some 'interesting' people hanging around. But frankly that's pretty common around many large European train stations. The other plus about the location is there are a few 'general' stores one block away, including Lidl and Rossmann. The hotel has some nice public hangout areas and the wifi (in-room) was very good. If I had to mention one small negative, it's that there seemed to be constant door slamming- luckily not at night/sleep time. I'm not sure if the walls and floors are thin or the doors are just heavy. Anyway, overall I would recommend this place- I liked it!

Show more
Michael , United States
Le Meridien Munich
8 Very good
Based on 99 reviews

We really enjoyed out stay here. The hotel offered everything as advertised and the room, bar, restaurant and spa facilities were excellent.

The in house prices were high but i suppose they reflect the overall standard of the hotel. We used the onsite parking which, at 20 euros for 24 hours was not over the top. The hotel was about 15 minutes walk from the main attractions and literally over the road from the main station so ideal for those travelling by train. Spa facilities are excellent and just what you need at the end of a busy sightseeing day.

Show more
robert , United Kingdom
Leonardo Hotel & Residenz Munich
8.1 Excellent
Based on 636 reviews

The stay was okay, nothing special. The hotel is pretty new, seems more like a refurbished apartment with its decent room size, kitchenette and balcony.

We booked a double room but got a twin one instead which we requested to change. The man at the reception doesn't seem to know that much about the hotel, had to check with his colleague and ultimately gave us a double room without much fuss actually. Can't really answer our questions with regards to laundry services as well. One thing that irks me was that the WIFI was PAINFULLY SLOW and that is pretty unacceptable for me if you claim to be a modern 4 star hotel. Kitchenette was lacking amenities and pan which basically meant you can only cook instant noodles. There were many bugs in our room near the window at first, but thankfully we changed to another room. Toilet lacks all the amenities other than a body wash. Overall average, good for its price and location but that's it. If you are on a budget trip this is a good hotel to stay.

Show more
Clarence , Singapore
Hotel Cristal
7.8 Very good
Based on 414 reviews

We are not able to review the Hotel Cristal as we did not stay there. When we arrived we were told there was a problem and we were sent to a two star hotel that belongs to the same organisation.

This seemed to be a standard practice as other guests were told the same and the waiters at breakfast had lists of guests from both hotels. The other hotel is a two star and looks quite dingy on the outside and this is not what we would have booked. The Cristal advertises itself as a four star hotel . It gives what seems to be good deals and then puts you in a two star hotel. This seems like dubious business practice. We stayed two nights and were allowed to use the breakfast buffet in compensation. We had not booked for breakfast. One morning at the Cristal we had a very good breakfast and the next morning we were told to eat at the Dolomite which was not so good. The room at the Dolomite was large and recently modernised and belied the drab exterior. The security at the Dolomite was far less good than that at the Cristal and this is an area with pole dancing clubs and some social problems.

Show more
Christopher , United Kingdom
Holiday Inn Munich - Westpark
8.8 Excellent
Based on 132 reviews

Maybe we started shopping around for a Munich hotel too late so we were left very few choices. Between ranking and space, we chose space.

For the money we paid, this hotel provids much larger rooms than hotels of higher star ranking. Besides it's being not luxurious doesn't mean it's lousy. It's a simple, clean and neat modern design hotel best for business travelers. Besides Oktoberfest, we paid a visit to the city's football club - Bayern Munich and watched a match there.

Show more
Lai , Hong Kong
Hotel Drei Loewen
7.9 Very good
Based on 69 reviews

Although the neighborhood is a bit seedy with homeless people sleeping on the sidewalks, we felt safe walking to Marienplatz and back again.

The reason we chose this hotel is because we had a rental car with us and parking is a major problem normally. There is a public parking ramp not far from the hotel which solved the problem of what to do with the car. We walked everywhere once we parked the car. And if you are arriving by train and need to get back on the train the next day, this hotel is also a great option. It is dated but very clean. The staff was so helpful and knowledgeable. Excellent customer service! The room itself was nice and included a little refrigerator. We moved over the bottles to buy and put our own water inside. The bathroom was updated with nice little bottles of shampoo and other products. Slippers were in the closet. All in all, a great experience.

Show more
Celeste , United States
Platzl Hotel
9 Excellent
Based on 86 reviews

We stayed here for 4 nights, on the final leg of our Swiss-German trip. A lovely, old-school property very close to the heart of the town and the shopping high-street.

The rooms were comfortable, the breakfast was crowded but excellent and the whole experience was extremely pleasant. We loved their Bavarian restaurant too - Ayingers - I had the best pretzel of the trip, and I daresay, the best beer too. Pros: Excellent location Good food The refreshing water at the lobby (with pears or cucumber or oranges)! Special mention to the Indian gentleman at the lobby, who helped us with our luggage Cons: None to speak of - we had a comfortable and pleasant stay, which is just what we needed at the end of the vacation.

Show more
Gautam , India
Hotel La Maison
8.2 Excellent
Based on 31 reviews

Sofitel Munich Bayerpost Hotel
8.5 Excellent
Based on 199 reviews

The in the internet advertised „beautiful city view“ was a view onto a depressing compartment wall. But after complaining the room was changed and the new room provided a view to the lively areaway around the main station – which at least could be counted as “cityview”.

The room itself was small and in terms of housekeeping in a bad condition. The shower was muggy smelling, the plug hole was full of long hairs, so the water didn’t flow off, at the windowsill decaying cigarette stubs were found, beneath the table with the nespresso-machine several portions of coffee were scattered on the carpet and on one pillow was a little blood stain. All in all disappointing. Irritating was an employee of the hotel who entered the room while I was in there and left without excuse or explanation. Especially irritating was that he did it twice – and during I stood one meter away from him. The customer relations manager did excuse very kind. The breakfast was not very inspiring – the choice of bread was simply pathetic for a hotel of that class in Germany. At least the Spa was a bit consoling – the pool doesn’t more than make you wet, but the sauna is really nice. At the latest in the end, when it comes to pay the bill, you might leave with some anger in your stomach – at least when you have arrived by car and have been that ill-advised to park it in the hotel’s garage. Because after you paid quite something for the mediocre room you’ll pay another something for the car. That was the moment I’ve decided not to return here ever again.

Show more
Lutz , Germany
Hotel Dolomit
7.5 Very good
Based on 568 reviews

I had a terrible night here. The room was stinky and dirty. It was so small and the draining system in the shower and wash basin was terrible.

I had to beware not to let the water flood over the toilet floor when I took a shower. In my room, it had no curtain. It had only the blinds outside the window which would give you a terrible noise to wake you up all night during the windy time. Also it was extremely noisy at night with the sound from the road in front of the hotel. This hotel is so highly not recommended at all otherwise you will have an unpleasant and terrible night in Munich!!! Also the receptionist was not that helpful. Anyway, the location is at the center of the city. very near to the train station. There are some shop and stripper bar nearby if you like to stay in this kind of atmosphere. It's also near supermarket and shopping center too. Consider the tradeoffs yourself.

Show more
Charnwit , Thailand
Eurostars Grand Central Hotel
8.4 Excellent
Based on 279 reviews

We like this place for its relatively close proximity to the railway station and Marienplaz both about 8 mins walk away.

We were there in early August......so we actually won't mind even if its further, the weather was nice for strolling! Travelling in Munich is heavenly. Their transport system is really clean and efficient and very convenient! Trains actually arrive and start on the dot!! We got very cheap and sweet berries from Marienplatz! My husband enjoyed the BMW Museum while my daughter and I sipped coffee and ate yummy pastries and sausages on the slopes of a nearby big carnival grounds with lots of nice green fields and families having picnics and many food stalls selling all kinds of delicious food and deserts!! We went to many fantastic food places, cannot remember most but caught one named Augustiner am Dom on photo! All in all, we will definitely go back to visit Munich and stay in this comfy hotel again and hopefully they will give us a '2nd time stay'discount ;-) Oh, I forgot to mention the best ~ the fantastic breakfast spread!! Many types of breads and croissants and really freshly squeezed orange juice!! I always never drink juices at breakfast when travelling coz most hotels serve preserved juices.......but this place give the real stuff!!

Show more
Happy , Singapore
Hotel Germania
7.5 Very good
Based on 391 reviews

I did not have a stay at Hotel Germania at all, because the stay was supposed to be for September. During the booking, the computer reset on the time and booked me for June 26th (the automatic next day date), instead of September 26th.

Since I did not receive an immediate confirmation, and had to pick up children from school, when I checked the confirmation, it was too late to change the reservation! I had to pay for a nights hotel stay that I did not even take. When I called customer service, the charges to call were so high that my account emptied, and I didn't want to pay to call back to be put on hold again. The Hotel Germania said they could do nothing for me. I wasted 200 dollars on nothing, and do not plan to ever use Agoda again.

Show more
Katie , Germany
Maritim Hotel Munich
7.8 Very good
Based on 254 reviews

relatively comfortable room compared with other places in munich. the room is a bit small but sufficient but rooms in munich of this rate are all small.

but the bed is (too) large. air-conditioner is central and no temperature adjustment and no ironing facility either. cable-based internet is available but no wi-fi. elevator seem to be too few and overcrowed for this size of hotel. the point is its hauptbahnhof location is convenient for commuting to many places both local and long-distance. many economy restaurant are nearby even though many of them are closed on sunday. i have not tried the hotel breakfast with costs an elevated eur 22 for full buffet. the front office staffs are very helpful and informative but the housekeeping people are different: you always have to request for glass which is supposed to be there. the hotel has a decent swimming pool but the housekeeper there is not so nice either especially when you don't sprechen deutsche. there is a very small fitness room.

Show more
sorarat , Thailand
Regent Hotel
7.3 Very good
Based on 684 reviews

We had stayed at the Regent Hotel 2 or 3 times in the past and repeated because of its attractive prices and convenient access to and from the airport.

We had notified the property in advance that we would arrive early in order to request considerarion for early check-in after a long journey. Unfortunately no rooms were available, and the staff at reception kept our bags for safekeeping while we went out to tour the city. When we returned to go to our room, we were very pleasantly surprised to receive a complimentary upgrade to a suite. We stayed in very nice chambers with a TV room and small refrigerator. All the furniture was in top shape and seemed brand new! The bed was very comfortable. We we impressed by the bathroom with double shower and double sink! Most staff members speak at least German, English, and Spanish. They were friendly and competent, and we truly appreciated the gesture of the upgrade! We will definitely consider the Regent Hotel again when we return to Munich.

Show more
Gunther , Mexico
NH München Ost Conference Center
8 Very good
Based on 60 reviews

It is a nice place to stay, but lacks a few things as a 4 star hotel. First it does not have kettle and tea/coffee stuff in the rooms.

It also does not have a safe in teach room, but they do have safe to keep your valuables in the reception. Once I ordered a glass of coke in the room and they charged me 5.5 Euros for the service( apart from the price of the coke)!, but then when I mentioned that to the reception staff, they reduced it. It is a bit far from the city centre, but good transportation service in Germany has solved this issue. There is a short walking/bicycle path from the Reim station to the hotel which takes only 6 minutes to get to the hotel, but you need to ask the hotel staff to show you that. For the first time, we had difficulty finding the hotel and in fact we ended up being lost in that region at night which was a bit scary!

Show more
Majid , Iraq
Hotel Kavun
6.8 Good
Based on 52 reviews

There is no lobby in the hotel. You need to go to the lobby of the hotel opposite. The staff are rude and impolite.

No kettles in the room. When I asked for help by the phone, the staff did not receive calls. When I came to the lobby, they asked me to bring my own cup for getting hot water, impolitely. When I could not find the hot water machine, that staff member ridiculed me and my friend. The absence of lobby means that all people can easily come into the building. Sometimes the main door was not locked. The cleaning service was unacceptable. They did not change the towels. We basically picked the place by price but it turned out to be a lucky accident. The hotel (more like a guest house or lodging, since there is no room service) is in a great location, just off Marienplatz and walking distance from most attractions in Munich.

It is also easily accessible by tram (from station/bus centre) and by U and S Bahn (airport). Breakfast is good. No lifts, no bell boy or any such frills so lugging up luggage to higher floors is a haul. Our triple room turned out to be two rooms with a common bathroom, which was a bonus. The place is old and shows signs of age and could do with some renovation, but the beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. There was even a fire alarm one night to make life exciting, but the police and fire service responded within minutes and the hotel managed to give breakfast the next day, which was nice. Internet has to be paid for which is a bummer (even cafes give you free internet for the price of a coffee!) But the viktualmarkt outside the hotel is a gourmet food market and has some nice cafes and a beer garden! Not a place for business travellers, but good for budget travellers and families.

Munich is really great, this city has so many good things, the people are really friendly and helpful, so many history building, museums, also castles, and many sighseeing places, i was in berlin before i went to munich, but i like munich more, this city is really amazing :D

Munich is a wonderful city to visit and is easy to get around by public transport or walking. We did two organized walking tours, otherwise we did self guided tours.

van den IJssel ,Australia

Munich is a great city and provides a lot of hospitality. Visit the Vikzalienmarket with it's local market stands and drink a cool beer under the walnut trees.

In the evening you can visit a concert for free in the church just nearby or visit the busy Hofbräuhaus. The Lenbachhachhaus provides a nice collection of new art and the Old Pinakotek serves your eyes with the finest pieces of Dutch paintings. Another nice beer garden is located near the central station and called Augustinerkeller and always worth a visit. Munich is also famous for castles as Nymphenburg or Oberschleißheim. Important to visit is also the concentration camp Dachau to get in touch with the cruel history of the Nazi regime. All in all, Munich is a great place to visit.

More about Munich

Munich is a city of beautiful architecture and natural beauty, with a culture that celebrates a good lager. The city and culture so enjoy their beer, it’s the home of the world-famous Oktoberfest, a two-week long festival celebrating all things beer. Oktoberfest attracts around six million visitors a year, making it a little tricky to book a hotel in Munich during the period of late September through early October.

Munich is home to some of the best museums in Germany, as well as war memorials and public parks. The Englischer Garten in Schwabing is home to one of the city's biggest beer gardens and Riemer Park is where locals often head for a swim.

The city is also home to many Bavarian castles. The baroque Schloss Nyphenburg is within walking distance of Hirschgarten while Residenz Museum is found right in the city center, surrounded by some of the most historic buildings and hotels in Munich.

One of the best times to visit Munich is from late November to the end of December. This is when the Christmas Markets fill the city with lights and special Christmas events.

Munich Franz Josef Strauss Airport is the city's main gateway, located around 40 minutes outside the city center.

There’s much more to see and learn about Munich, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.

The carpeting on our floor seemed a bit worn, and we would recommend changing it. More importantly, we had requested early check-in because we arrived after an intercontinental trip. We stored our luggage and went out in weather that was below freezing. Upon returning at 12:30 PM, our room was in fact prepared. All staff members with whom we interacted were polite and professional, and we would have been even happier with our stay if the original request for early check-in had been granted from the moment of our arrival. There was even a fire alarm one night to make life exciting, but the police and fire service responded within minutes and the hotel managed to give breakfast the next day, which was nice. Internet has to be paid for which is a bummer (even cafes give you free internet for the price of a coffee!) But the viktualmarkt outside the hotel is a gourmet food market and has some nice cafes and a beer garden! Not a place for business travellers, but good for budget travellers and families. Wong ,Singapore Discover the neighborhoods of Munich Hauptbahnhof 102 hotels Maxvorstadt 56 hotels Schwabing 41 hotels Ludwigsvorstadt 39 hotels Altstadt-Lehel 39 hotels Messe 27 hotels Sendling 26 hotels Haidhausen 24 hotels Isarvorstadt 24 hotels Milbertshofen-Am Hart 21 hotels Bogenhausen 20 hotels Perlach 18 hotels Schwanthalerhöhe 18 hotels Trudering 15 hotels Obersendling 14 hotels Berg am Laim 14 hotels Munich International Airport 14 hotels Nymphenburg 13 hotels Pasing 12 hotels Obermenzing 11 hotels Find the Perfect Type of Accommodation Apartments in Munich 41 Guest Houses in Munich 36 Serviced Apartments in Munich 29 Hostels in Munich 15 More about Munich Munich is a city of beautiful architecture and natural beauty, with a culture that celebrates a good lager. The city and culture so enjoy their beer, it’s the home of the world-famous Oktoberfest, a two-week long festival celebrating all things beer. Oktoberfest attracts around six million visitors a year, making it a little tricky to book a hotel in Munich during the period of late September through early October. Munich is home to some of the best museums in Germany, as well as war memorials and public parks. The Englischer Garten in Schwabing is home to one of the city's biggest beer gardens and Riemer Park is where locals often head for a swim. The city is also home to many Bavarian castles. The baroque Schloss Nyphenburg is within walking distance of Hirschgarten while Residenz Museum is found right in the city center, surrounded by some of the most historic buildings and hotels in Munich. One of the best times to visit Munich is from late November to the end of December. This is when the Christmas Markets fill the city with lights and special Christmas events. Munich Franz Josef Strauss Airport is the city's main gateway, located around 40 minutes outside the city center. There’s much more to see and learn about Munich, and the interactive map on this page is a great way to find out where the attractions and hotels can be found in this exciting city.
